sourceDesc.p:
Object record derived from SALT Research Digital Archives:
https://archives.saltresearch.org/handle/123456789/106997 . Attributed to Gentile Bellini, created ca. 1480 during his stay at the Ottoman court of Sultan Mehmed II following the 1479 Peace Treaty between the Ottoman Empire and the Republic of Venice. Source metadata accessed via SALT Research under their standard non-commercial use agreement.

objectDesc.p: Obverse: profile bust of Sultan Mehmed II with Latin titulature (MAGNI SOVLTANI MOHAMETI IMPERATORIS). Reverse: Latin signature by Gentile Bellini (GENTILIS BELLINVS VENETVS EQVES AVRATVS COMES PALATINVS F.) and three crowns symbolizing dominion over Graecia, Asia, and Trebizond.

event.label: Ottoman–Venetian Peace Treaty
event.desc: Peace ends the 1463–1479 war; conditions allow renewed diplomatic and artistic exchanges.

event.label: Gentile Bellini in Constantinople
event.desc: Bellini is invited by Sultan Mehmed II to the Ottoman court to produce portraits and medals.

event.label: Mehmed II Medal (ca. 1480)
event.desc: Medal with imperial obverse and Bellini’s Latin signature on reverse; three crowns symbolize Graecia, Asia, Trebizond.

event.label: Bellini returns to Venice
event.desc: After Mehmed II’s death, Bellini departs from the Ottoman court and returns to Venice.

person.note: Ottoman sultan and patron of the arts; initiates invitation to Bellini.
Venetian artist; Gold Knight and Count Palatine; active at the Ottoman court ca. 1479–1481.

notesStmt.note: The medal embodies cultural diplomacy: a Renaissance visual idiom serving Ottoman imperial image-making in the wake of a peace treaty. This record references SALT Research materials under non-commercial use.
